data.title: Aselsan Expands Defence Offer [INTERVIEW]
data.description: **Damian Ratka, Defence24.pl: Good morning Mr President. Aselsan is an internationally recognised, manufacturer of fire control systems for vehicles. Your latest product is the fire control system for the Altay Main Battle tank, if you can tell what its characteristics are?**

data.title: Col. Jackson: The V Corps and 2 Polish Corps have one of the strongest relationships in NATO
data.description: Defence24 had the opportunity to interview Col. Kevin Jackson, Chief of Staff V Corps U.S. Army. The interview occurred during the 2nd Territorial Defense Forces Symposium, organized jointly by the V Corps and the 2nd Polish Corps. At the same time, talks were also held at the highest level of bo...

data.title: East Front News #21: Russian nuclear doctrine update, Conventional IRBM Strike on Ukraine, Danish Navy Stopped a Chinese Ship
data.description: East Front News is a weekly newsletter summarizing the past week’s most important events concerning security and the situation in the Central and Eastern Europe region. It includes original opinions and comments, along with key news items significant from a Polish perspective. If you would like t...

data.title: Polish WZT-3 ARV in Service with Ukraine
data.description: Poland has provided Ukraine with numerous types of heavy military equipment, often numbering in the hundreds. This support was invaluable, particularly in 2022, when many countries hesitated to offer military aid to Kyiv or did so in a very limited manner. Rumors suggested that Poland’s aid packa...

data.title: Ukraine Hit by a Russian Intercontinental Ballistic Missile
data.description: **The Ukrainian Air Force said that the Russians had used an intercontinental ballistic missile to launch an attack on Ukraine. However, in all likehood this was an Intermediate-Range Ballistic Missile, though based on an ICBM.**

data.title: Poland's Government Adopts Draft Law on Ammunition Production Funding
data.description: Polish Council of Ministers has approved a draft law to ensure financing for initiatives aimed at increasing ammunition production, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defence Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz announced.

data.title: Danish Navy Stopped a Chinese Ship Suspected of Damaging Undersea Cables
data.description: **The Danish Navy has detained the Chinese bulk carrier Yi Peng 3, which is suspected of damaging telecommunications cables in the Baltic Sea.**

data.title: Brazil is Extending Search for New IFV. An Opportunity for Polish Borsuk?
data.description: **The Brazilian Armed Forces are looking for new armoured combat vehicles. As we recently reported, our new BWP Borsuk is to be among the designs under consideration.**

data.title: More Black Hawk Helicopters for the Polish Armed Forces
data.description: **Deputy Minister Paweł Bejda announced another delivery of helicopters to the Polish Armed Forces.**

data.title: Polish Ministry of Defence Announces Billion Contracts in Domestic Industry
data.description: During a press conference held alongside the signing of a contract for FlyEye drones, representatives of the Ministry of Defence (MON) announced plans to sign numerous agreements aimed at modernizing the Armed Forces through Poland’s domestic defence industry. Systems supporting artillery alone c...

title.translation: Polish Defence and Security Equipment Catalogue

description.translation: The Polish defence industry plays a significant role in the country’s economy and global standing. The Polish Defence And Security Equipment Catalogue showcases a range of advanced technologies and innovative solutions developed by Polish companies. These innovations span various sectors, including electronics, cyberspace, armoured vehicles and artillery systems, weapons systems, aerospace & space as well as air and missile defence, which highlights Poland’s leadership in defence and security. The Catalogue contains 207 products by 61 companies.

title.translation: NATO Summit in Washington

description.translation: President Andrzej Duda has said that no one from the outside can prevent Ukraine from joining NATO as such a decision is taken by alliance members and Ukrainians.

title.translation: Statement by President at Peace Summit for Ukraine in Switzerland

description.translation: President:  Ukraine, as a victim of this aggression, has the full right to defend its sovereignty and independence by any means that are in accordance with the international law. And it is the obligation of the entire international society to spare no efforts in supporting Kyiv in its struggles.

title.translation: Prague. Statement by President at ammunition summit

description.translation: President: The greatest responsibility for supplying ammunition and armaments to Ukraine lies with the West. This is in our common interest.

title.translation: Vancouver. President: We are NATO! We are stronger together!

description.translation: Address by the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda at the seminar „Transatlantic Security in the Shadow of Russia’s Long War”.

title.translation: Andrzej Duda's meeting with Donald Trump

description.translation: During his visit to New York, Polish President Andrzej Duda met with the 45th President of the United States Donald Trump.

title.translation: New York. President's meetings and talks at UN

description.translation: President Andrzej Duda's talks at the UN headquarters in New York were centred on security issues in the context of the ongoing conflicts: in Ukraine and the Middle East, and sustainable development. The Polish leader and his Spouse are paying a visit to the United States.

title.translation: Letter from the President of the Republic of Poland to the leaders of NATO member states to mark the anniversary of the establishment of the Alliance

description.translation: President: 75 years ago the world's most powerful defense alliance was founded - a symbol of solidarity and the security foundation of the democratic community of the free world.

title.translation: White House. Speech by the President of the Republic of Poland

description.translation: President: Russia's aggression against Ukraine clearly demonstrated that the United States is and should remain the security leader! But other Allies must take more responsibility for the security of the Alliance as a whole.

title.translation: It is necessary to raise the level of defense spending from 2 to 3% of GDP by all members of the Alliance

description.translation: Address by the President of the Republic of Poland marking the 25th anniversary of Poland’s accession to  NATO:  I believe that it is necessary to raise the level of defense spending from 2 to 3 % of GDP by all members of the Alliance.

title.translation: KGP spokesman: the policeman whose gun was used in the shooting had been on duty for over a year

description.translation: On Saturday afternoon in Warsaw on Inżynierska Street, a police officer was injured during an intervention. **The officer died in hospital.** As reported by the Warsaw police, the weapon was used by a second police officer.

title.translation: Police officers "without the right to additional leave"?

description.translation: The Commissioner for Human Rights, Marcin Wiącek, informed Prime Minister Donald Tusk in a letter that he has been approached with a request for assistance by police officers whose **properties suffered during this year's flood**. Their requests concern additional leave, which they would like to use to remove the effects of the disaster. "Their superiors do not agree to this, because the regulations apply only to employees, not to persons in a service relationship," we read in the Commissioner for Human Rights' letter to the head of government.

title.translation: A policeman shot with his service weapon during an intervention in Warsaw has died

description.translation: "During the arrest of an aggressive man with a machete, **one of the officers used his service weapon, as a result of which the police officer was injured"** - the press service of the Warsaw police reported on Saturday afternoon. The incident took place at approx. 2 p.m. at Inżynierska in Warsaw. "The fight for the life of the police officer is ongoing, led by paramedics from the Meditrans Provincial Emergency Medical Service in Warsaw" - the ambulance service reported on social media.

title.translation: Russian spy protected US embassy? He fell into the hands of Norwegian services

description.translation: According to the Norwegian broadcaster Norsk Rikskringkasting (NRK), **the detainee allegedly admitted to collecting information and sharing it with the authorities of Russia and Iran**. This was revealed in an arrest warrant issued by the Oslo District Court. The court considers it probable that the man committed the crimes he is accused of. The order states, among other things, that **the police came across a conversation with the investigating officer**

title.translation: The government is introducing a new obligation. It concerns smoke and carbon monoxide detectors

description.translation: On Friday, a conference was held at the Fire Academy – as part of the European Smoke Detector Day, which falls on November 22nd. It was attended by the head of the Ministry of Interior and Administration, Tomasz Siemoniak, his deputy, Wiesław Leśniakiewicz, and the Chief Commandant of the State Fire Service, Senior Brigadier Mariusz Feltynowski. “A few months ago, two firefighters died in a tragic fire in Poznań. On that same day, the word ‘smoke detector’ became a hero for everyone, because thanks to the **smoke detector that was in this tenement house, all the residents were saved**” – said the Minister of Interior and Administration.

title.translation: Civil protection returns to the Sejm. Senate "for" the bill, but with amendments

description.translation: After the Sejm unanimously adopted the act on the protection of the population and civil defense on November 8, the document was submitted to the Senate. The upper house of parliament needed less than two weeks to deal with it. During a joint session of the Senate committees: Local Government and State Administration, Human Rights and the Rule of Law, and Legislative, senators initially proposed introducing 20 amendments to the document. During the second reading, parliamentarians submitted further amendments. **A total of 33 changes were proposed to the document.**

title.translation: They planned to attack the president. Brazilian police arrested the would-be attackers

description.translation: Brazil's Federal Police on Tuesday arrested members of a criminal group that was planning to assassinate the president after his victory over far-right politician and former military man Jair Bolsonaro in elections in late 2022.

title.translation: Border Guard "in need". Urgent investments valued at nearly 3 billion

description.translation: Construction of perimeters on the border with Ukraine, modernization of the training base, creation of additional places related to contract service and adaptation of buildings to health and safety and fire protection regulations - these are just some of the most urgent investments planned by the Border Guard. "The total needs of the Border Guard amount to over PLN 2.5 billion, closer to PLN 3 billion" - emphasized the deputy commander of the Border Guard, Brig. Gen. Wioleta Gorzkowska. It is worth recalling that the budget of the formation for next year - from which financing for the entire formation must be ensured - is slightly over PLN 3.1 billion.

title.translation: Revolution in Russian drug trade

description.translation: The Global Initiative Against Transnational Organized Crime (GITOC) has published a report entitled “Breaking Klad: Russia’s Dead Drop Drug Revolution,” which examines the groundbreaking changes in the illegal drug trade in Russia. The report was authored by Max Daly, a journalist and analyst specializing in drugs and organized crime, and Patrick Shortis, a researcher of online drug markets.

title.translation: Scandinavia prepares citizens for crisis. What about Poland?

description.translation: Swedish authorities have begun sending brochures to over 5 million households with advice on how to prepare for war or a sudden crisis. The Finnish government has taken similar action, launching a portal for war and crisis. The guides provide information on what to do in the event of a power outage, water shortage, a sudden attack on the country's borders, or natural disasters. Minister of Interior and Administration Tomasz Siemoniak was asked whether the Polish government has the same plans. He said that he does not rule it out, but that education is more important for now.

title.translation: US to deploy missile units to Japan if tensions rise over Taiwan

description.translation: The deployment of the missile units is to be part of the first joint U.S.-Japanese emergency plan for Taiwan, which is due in December.

title.translation: German frigate in Poland for the first time. "Peace" ship in Gdańsk

description.translation: The German unit has docked at the Oliwskie quay in Nowy Port. The visit, which will last until Monday, November 25, is of a working nature and is intended to allow the crew to rest and replenish supplies. The first visit of a ship of this type to Poland could have taken place three years ago, in September 2021, when the sister frigate Sachsen-Anhalt (F 224) entered the Gdańsk roadstead but did not dock.

title.translation: USA: Will Ukraine Lose Missiles to Indo-Pacific?

description.translation: The US Air Force and Navy need to relieve themselves of their tasks in Europe and the Middle East to ensure greater contingency readiness for operations in the Pacific, says the US Chief of Indo-Pacific Command, Admiral Samuel Paparo.

title.translation: S-80 submarines finally with AIP drive

description.translation: The S-80 submarine construction program in Spain has entered a new phase. The Navantia shipyard in Cartagena has begun installing the AIP air-independent propulsion system on the third submarine of this type (S-83 "Cosme García"). The success is all the greater because this drive was developed in Spain, and additionally it is of a completely new generation, differing in its operating principle from solutions previously used on other submarines.

title.translation: Sweden with NATO defense plan [ANALYSIS]

description.translation: The Swedish government has submitted a bill proposing that the country make its military forces available to NATO to counter potential threats in the North Atlantic. The bill, pending approval by the Swedish parliament, outlines Stockholm's contribution to the alliance in the form of land forces, naval units, warships and combat aircraft.

title.translation: French Foreign Minister: We have no "red lines" when it comes to support for Ukraine

description.translation: French Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot told the BBC that Paris has no "red lines" (borders that must not be crossed) nor does it rule out "any option" in advance when it comes to support for Ukraine.

title.translation: Flying grenade launcher from Ukraine

description.translation: The Ukrainian Armed Forces have a very high demand for all types of drones, which results not only from their effectiveness in combat, but in many cases they are also a "substitute" for other types of weapons that Kiev does not have or has in insufficient quantities (e.g. artillery ammunition or anti-tank missiles). Combat experience, technological capabilities acquired, and the availability of simple solutions from the civilian market have contributed to the creation of many simple and cheap drones capable of performing so-called kinetic missions.

title.translation: Kiev's Plans in the Shadow of Biden's Agreement: The Concept of War on Russian Territory [ANALYSIS]

description.translation: Joe Biden, who is leaving the presidency, has allowed Ukraine to hit targets using American missiles on the territory of the Russian Federation. This is nothing new, as the American administration took a similar step in the case of the Russian offensive operation in the direction of Kharkov, where Kiev was given the green light to hit targets near Belgorod.

title.translation: Territorials show their allies their experience with Warmate

description.translation: The Loitering Munitions Conference, organized in the UK, gathered several hundred participants from a dozen or so different countries. They were representatives of the armies specializing in the use of loitering ammunition systems, NATO structures and commands, as well as the international defense industry. During the conference, the Polish side was represented by, among others, a representative of the Territorial Defense Force Command and the Deputy Head of the Warmate Team from the WOT Training Center in Toruń, who gave a speech on "CSWOT cooperation with WB Electronics within one of the largest programs concerning the loitering ammunition system".

title.translation: Budanov: Teachers, journalists and clergy were supposed to be on the Russians' "execution lists"

description.translation: "The execution lists were to include teachers of the Ukrainian language, literature and history, veterans of anti-terrorist operations, journalists, scientists, writers, clergy of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church and other denominations who supported Ukraine, public figures, politicians, heads of state and local government bodies," Budanov revealed during Friday's discussion "Russian genocidal practices in Ukraine: from the Holodomor to the Russian-Ukrainian war."
